strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: Aaooow!
<se_def>*: Ascantha is in a period of official mourning for our late Queen.
<se_def>*: So don't go making any unnecessary noise!
<se_def>*: It's been two long years now since the Queen passed away. But the King...
<se_def>*: Er, never mind.

<se_def>*: Hm? I've not seen you before.
Are you <IF_SOLO>a customer<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>customers<ENDIF_SOLO>?
<se_def>*: Oh, you are! Well, then...
<se_def>*: If you don't mind, please try not to talk too loudly.
<se_def>*: I'll get told off by the guards if you make too much noise, you see.
<se_high>*: We're not allowed to laugh, we're not allowed to speak loudly... We're not allowed to have fun or be happy at all.
<se_high>*: We just have to spend every day praying in silence. Those are the King's orders.
<se_high>*: ...Er, welcome. How may I help you...?

<se_high>*: You're <IF_SOLO>a traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>, aren't you?
Then hurry up and leave for another town.
<se_high>*: If you stay here too long, you'll just end up feeling depressed like the rest of us.
<se_high>*: If you're buying, then make it quick.
<se_high>*: If only the King would get better again.

<se_high>*: It's been two years now. We all have to wear mourning clothes and everyone is so gloomy,
it's unbearable!

<se_high>*: I'm fed up with always being indoors!
I want to go and play outside!
<se_def>*: Oh!

<se_def>* You're not from around here, are you?
Whatever brings you to a place like this?
<se_def>*: I don't want to speak out of turn, but you should leave now. As soon as you can.
<se_def>*: Everyone here's cooped up indoors mourning the late Queen.
<se_def>*: I know it must be hard to lose someone you love, but two years is far too long for us all to suffer like this.
<se_low>*: The Queen was so intelligent and level-headed.
<se_low>*: She was a pillar of strength for the King.

<se_low>*: I'm sure if she could see him now,
she'd tell him to pull himself together!
<se_def>*: How strange that you want to stay here at a time like this.
<se_def>*: ...Not that it's for me to stop you.
<se_high>*: The King and Queen often used to sit and talk in the park in front of our inn.
<se_high>*: They were such a wonderful couple, so good together...
<se_low>*: Every night, the sound of the King's sobbing plunges the country deeper into misery.
<se_low>*: If those left behind suffer so much, the souls of the dead cannot rise to heaven...
<se_high>*: The black cloth covering the castle is there to show that we're all sad.
<se_high>*: That's why we dress like this, too. We haven't been allowed to wear anything but black for two whole years now.
<se_def>*: This is Ascantha Castle.
<se_def>*: But whatever brings you here to our kingdom?
<se_def>*: When I was a child, I never missed a chance to go off climbing mountains and swimming in rivers.
<se_def>*: I'd often make a right mess of my clothes and come home to an ear-bending from my mum.
<se_def>*: There's not much work for me to do with everyone just praying, so I try to pass the time with idle chit-chat.
<se_high>*: I always try to cook His Majesty's favourite meals, but he won't eat so much as a bite.
<se_high>*: If he keeps on like this, he'll end up joining our dear departed Queen.
<se_high>*: His Majesty's maid, Emma, has been working so hard these past two years. She hasn't taken a single day's holiday.
<se_high>*: The King's still spending every day in tears despite her best efforts, though. It must be very hard on her.
<se_def>*: The audience chamber is just upstairs.
<se_def>*: But if you've come to see the King, I'm afraid you'll be disappointed. The Minister deals with visitors nowadays.
<se_low>*: ...Ah! It's most unusual for us to have visitors here. Welcome to Ascantha.
<se_low>*: Regrettably, you find us in mourning for our late Queen, so the King is presently unavailable. I'm afraid I must request that you leave.
<se_low>*: The King will not meet with anyone.<page>*: Unfortunately, he has eschewed the company of friends and visitors for two years now, ever since the Queen died.
<se_low>*: He spends the daylight hours ensconced in his chambers...<page>*: ...and then at night he descends to the royal suite where he sits until morning, consumed by melancholy.
<se_low>*: He's so consumed by misery that it doesn't seem right to disturb him...
<se_def>*: The King's chamber is just upstairs.
<se_high>Emma: Our King has been unavailable to visitors ever since the Queen passed away two years ago.
<se_high>Emma: He comes down to the royal suite every night, but I doubt that he'll grant you an audience.
<se_high>Emma: ...I realise that must seem strange to you, but if you return after dark, you'll see for yourselves.
<se_def>*: When the Queen was still with us, Ascantha was a prosperous and lively place to be.

<se_def>*: But look at us now. The King's wailing can
be heard across the whole town every night.
It's killing us.
<se_low>*: Ah, look how beautiful the moon is tonight. There's a little tale I can tell you about that, actually.
<se_low>*: If you go to the top of the mountain on the night of a full moon, any wish you make will come true.
<se_low>*: There are some spectacular views from up there. Just head down towards the lake and you'll come across it soon enough.<page>*: We all call it Wishers' Peak.

<se_def>*: King Pavan was a great man. He still is.
It's just...
<se_def>*: His eyes are always clouded with misery now. There's no life in him any more.

<se_high>*: Can you hear it? The desperation?
That's the King calling out for Queen Sasha.
<se_high>*: It reaches us on the wind every single night. He's always calling for her, sobbing for her until dawn.
<se_high>*: Aw, I want to go and play outside.
<se_def>*: If it carries on like this much longer, I might leave Ascantha and move somewhere else.
<se_def>*: It's where I've lived all my life, but it's just not the same any more.
<se_high>*: Oh, can't you sleep? Then why don't you make yourself comfortable and I'll tell you an old folk tale?
<se_high>*: Since long, long ago, a mysterious being has lived on the other side of the Moonshadow window.

<se_high>*: If you're lucky enough to meet with him,
he will grant you any wish.
But once and only once.
<se_def>*: The late Queen was a beautiful and intelligent woman.
<se_def>*: The people of Ascantha were genuinely sad to see her go. It's not just because of the King's orders.
<se_high>*: If someone I loved died, I'd want to die too.
<se_high>*: Otherwise, how would I get to see them again?

<se_low>*: The night is a time when people's hearts
become clouded with memories, often dark
and sad.
<se_low>*: The King's never-ending grief is smothering every corner of our land.
<se_high>Emma: Please, dear Goddess. Release the King from his misery. Our poor, gentle King.
<se_high>Emma: If miracles can really happen, then please let King Pavan meet with Queen Sasha one more time. Just one more time...
<se_high>Emma: I've tried so hard, but there's nothing I can do to help him. Please, Goddess, I beg of you...
<se_high>*: Emma prays for the King like that every night.
<se_high>*: She must be exhausted from looking after him all day, but she always makes time to pray.
<se_high>*: If I were the Goddess, I'd make Emma's wish come true. But it's just not possible to meet with the dead.
<se_def>*: When I was a child, I used to go and see the old lady who lives in the house next to the bridge. She'd tell me lots of strange old tales.
<se_def>*: She's the grandmother of Emma, the girl who works as a maid here at the castle. She knows more about this area than anyone.
<se_def>*: Apparently, you come to a strange mountain if you go far enough along the riverbank, but there's no proper path up to the top.
<se_def>*: There is some kind of cave a long way upstream, though...
<se_def>*: Hm, I'm not sure what to make of what those two said. No doubt there is something quite incredible at the top of the mountain upriver.
<se_def>*: But there are a lot of monsters around there, too.
<se_high>*: I wonder how much longer Emma's going to be at church tonight.
<se_high>*: She's got an early morning as usual tomorrow. If she doesn't get some sleep soon, she'll be fit for nothing.
<se_high>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_def>*: During the night, we can always hear the King crying up in the royal suite.
<se_def>*: He just can't seem to get over Queen Sasha's death.
<se_def>*: The Minister has already retired for the night. Please come back and pay him a visit tomorrow.
<se_low>*: Everything has been neglected over the past two years, even political matters. I don't know what will become of us if this continues.
<se_low>*: If only there were some way to lift the King's spirits. I'm at a loss.
<se_def>King Pavan: ...Why?
<se_def>King Pavan: Why did you have to go to heaven and leave me all alone, my dear Sasha?
<se_def>King Pavan: It's been two long years. Time stopped for me when you left. I'm sure my heart died with you.

<se_def>King Pavan: Just one more time, even in my dreams...
If only I could just see you one more time.
<se_def>King Pavan: Without you, my crown and my throne mean nothing. I'm helpless here, left all alone.

<se_def>King Pavan: Please, my darling Sasha.
Come to me one last time.
If you don't, I, I...
<se_def>*: Zzzz... Nothing to report...
<se_def>*: (Gurgle gurgle)
<se_def>*: Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Zzzzz...
<se_high>*: Guuuurgh...

<se_high>*: No, no, no...
I can't eat that much...!
Huuuh...
<se_high>Emma: ...Please...Goddess...the King...uhh...
<se_low>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_def>*: This is...the Minister's... Zzzzz!
<se_def>*: Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: If you spend all your time wishing for the past, you have no future. That's what's happening here now.
<se_def>*: On the day our Queen died, our country may as well have died with her.
<se_high>Emma: Please. I need your help. Go and see my grandmother. She lives in a house west of here, next to a bridge.
<se_high>Emma: I want you to get her to tell the old story about how to make wishes come true.
<se_high>Emma: Maybe it's just a fairy tale, but if there's any chance it might be true, then I have to try and help the King.
<se_high>Emma: I'd do anything to help him see Queen Sasha again, even if it were just for a moment.

<se_high>Emma: I wish I could go and ask her myself,
but there's so much to do here at the castle.
And I can't leave him on his own...

<se_high>Emma: I'm really counting on your help.
My grandmother lives west of Ascantha,
in a house next to a bridge.

<se_high>Emma: Ah, you're back! How was it?
What did my grandmother say!?
<se_high>Emma: Really? So it's that huge mountain up the river? That's the place where you go to get your wish granted!?
<se_high>Emma: Oh... Now what do I do!? I'll never be able to climb up something that high.
<se_high>Emma: I'd give anything to make the King's wish come true, but now it looks like I'm stuck...
<se_high>Emma: Can it really be that my only hope is prayer? Oh...

<se_def>*: So the King is crying again tonight,
as always.
<se_def>*: Before the Queen died, he was a wise and well-respected man. But now...
<se_def>*: Emma's a good girl. She works all day long, and still finds the time to check on the King, in between her prayers, at night.
<se_def>*: I hope she doesn't overdo it, burning the candle at both ends like that.
<se_low>*: The King is too sensitive for his own good. His loss has blinded him to everything else.
<se_low>*: It must be a terrible strain for Emma.
<se_def>King Pavan: ...Sasha. Please come to me. I don't care if you're real, or if seeing you means I'm mad. I have to see you again...somehow...
<se_def>King Pavan: Otherwise I, I... Perhaps I should follow you... Perhaps it's time...
<se_high>*: If only somebody, anybody, could cheer the King up! This has gone on long enough.

<se_def>*: Aargh! This is getting to be too much!
Yet another wasted day praying and doing precious little else!
<se_def>*: I'm sure this isn't what the Queen would have wanted.

<se_low>*: If only I was a bit steadier on my feet,
I'd climb that mountain and pray for the
King's happiness.

<se_low>*: You're not from around these parts, so you probably don't know what I'm on about.<page>*: There's an old wives' tale around these parts that goes something like...<page>*: ‘By full moon's light, to the mountain go, then think of a wish and it shall be so!’.
<se_low>*: It has to be on a full moon, mind. Where? Hmm. The old couple that live near the bridge to the west of Ascantha can probably tell you that.

<se_low>*: The King won't hear our prayers.
And the Goddess won't hear his.
Who should we pray to now?
<se_low>*: I just don't know any more...
<se_low>*: Unfortunate <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>, it is most regrettable that you should happen upon our country at a time like this.
<se_low>*: You find us in mourning for the late Queen, so I'm afraid the King cannot see you. I must ask you to leave.
<se_high>Emma: Please. I need your help. Go and see my grandmother. She lives in a house west of here, next to a bridge.
<se_high>Emma: I want you to get her to tell the old story about how to make wishes come true.
<se_high>Emma: Maybe it's just a fairy tale, but if there's any chance it might be true, then I have to try and help the King.
<se_high>Emma: I'd do anything to help him see Queen Sasha again, even if it were just for a moment.
<se_high>Emma: I wish I could go and ask her myself, but there's so much to do here at the castle. And I can't leave him on his own...
<se_high>Emma: I'm counting on your help. My grandmother lives west of Ascantha, in a house next to a bridge.

<se_high>Emma: Ah, you're back! How was it?
What did my grandmother say!?
<se_high>Emma: Really? So it's that huge mountain up the river? That's the place where you go to get your wish granted!?
<se_high>Emma: Oh... Now what do I do!? I'll never be able to climb up something that high.
<se_high>Emma: I'd give anything to make the King's wish come true, but now it looks like I'm stuck...
<se_high>Emma: Can it really be that my only hope is prayer? Oh...

<se_def>King Pavan: So you're chasing after a jester called
Dhoulmagus?
<se_def>King Pavan: Well, I'm afraid I haven't heard talk of anyone like that passing through Ascantha.

<se_def>King Pavan: That's not much use to you, I know. And there I was, just now, saying I wanted to help you.
I'm sorry.

<se_low>Yangus: Eh!
Where'd that Itchy-Marie bloke disappear to!?
<se_low>Yangus: Feels like it was all some kinda weird dream, dunnit?

<se_high>Jessica: That made me think about Alistair.
I suppose he lives on too, in my heart...
<se_def>Angelo: So that sissy of a King has finally pulled himself together and started to behave like a real man again!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Er, you know what I mean. I didn't mean to blurt it out quite like that, though. Maybe I've had a bit too much of the old moonshine.
<se_def>*: Last night was great, wasn't it!? It's been years since we had an all-night banquet like that.
<se_def>*: Thanks so much for cheering the King up for us! Have a safe trip!

<se_def>*: Now that the King's back to normal,
we're ready to do our jobs properly again!
We'll do him proud!
<se_def>*: Atten-SHUN!
<se_low>*: Emma worked tirelessly during the two years of His Majesty's depression.

<se_low>*: It's time she was given a decent holiday,
and more besides.

<se_def>*: The King's chamber is just upstairs.
Please go on up.
<se_high>Emma: This room has been kept just as it was when the Queen died two years ago.
<se_high>Emma: But His Majesty has finally ordered for it to be tidied up, so that's what I'm doing now.
<se_def>*: This is Ascantha Castle. Welcome!
<se_def>*: It's been a long time since I've properly taken care of my equipment. It's busy work!
<se_high>*: I really got to show off my skills last night! What did you think of the banquet?
<se_high>*: I finally had the chance to see everyone enjoying my food. It was wonderful to see them all digging in like that!
<se_def>*: Welcome to Ascantha Castle!

<se_def>*: We love to have visitors here!
Welcome, welcome!

<se_def>*: Right then, let's do some business!
Step right up! Step right up!

<se_high>*: Hello there!
Isn't it an absolutely beautiful day!?

<se_high>*: The King is finally back to his normal,
happy self!
<se_high>*: Now our country can come back to life at last. What a blessed relief!

<se_high>*: Yay! I'm outside! I'm outside! It's so bright!
And look at all the space to play in!
<se_high>*: It's been a long time since we've been able to stand out in the sunshine chatting like this.
<se_high>*: It's great to be able to have a good old chinwag again.
<se_low>*: Rumour has it that the Queen's ghost visited the King and gave him a right royal scolding. That's why he pulled himself together.
<se_low>*: That's Queen Sasha for you! You could always depend on her to keep the King in line!

<se_def>*: Hey! Hello there!
You can't beat a nice walk, eh!?
<se_def>*: The King's guards say that he's like a different man now.
<se_def>*: It's not just that he's happier. It sounds like he's stronger-minded than he used to be as well.
<se_high>*: The King named my dog for me, you know. Didn't he, Tango?
<se_def>Tango: Woof woof!
<se_def>Tango: Woof woof!
<se_high>*: Now the King's maid, Emma, should finally be able to take some holiday and visit her family. She'll be so pleased!
<se_high>*: I got changed into my favourite dress and everything! Why do I have to stay here and look after the shop!? It's not fair!
<se_def>*: Aaoooow! Ruff ruff!

<se_high>*: Good evening, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>!
Isn't it a beautiful night!?

<se_def>*: Ah, what a pleasant breeze.
You can't beat a nice walk in the evening.
<se_def>*: Shh! Keep quiet! They'll spot you otherwise!
<se_def>King Pavan: You've been a very faithful servant to me over the past two years. I want to thank you.

<se_def>King Pavan: Why don't you take some time off?
It's about time you visited your family.
Take as long as you want.
<se_high>Emma: Thank you very much, Your Majesty. I'm just so pleased to see you looking happy again.
<se_high>Emma: Oh, it's you! Thank you so, so much!
<se_high>Emma: It looks like I'm going to be able to go home for a while!
<se_high>*: Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Urrrrh...
<se_low>*: Zzzzzzzz...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Zzzz...buy a new dress...zzzz...
<se_def>*: Nothing to report!
<se_high>*: I must've overdone it a bit, earlier. I can hardly keep my eyes open now. (Yawn)
<se_high>*: I wonder where Emma's got to? I'm running around like a mad thing trying to clear up after dinner here!
<se_high>*: Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Maybe it was a dream. I heard this incredible music, more beautiful than anything I've ever heard before...
<se_def>*: It's been a long time since I've seen the King looking so happy. What a relief!
<se_low>*: Zzzz... Zzzz...
<se_def>*: Welcome to Ascantha Castle!
<se_def>*: This is Ascantha Castle, home of His Majesty, King Pavan.

<se_def>*: By order of the King, all visitors shall
be allowed to come and go as they wish.
Please pass through!
<se_def>*: Sorry? The Moonshadow harp, you say?

<se_def>*: I'm afraid I only deal in weapons here.
I don't sell anything like that.
<se_high>*: Hello there, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>! Looking for something, are you? ...The Moonshadow harp?

<se_high>*: I've got a feeling I may have heard of that.
Or maybe not. Sorry, I can't quite remember.
<se_high>*: Moonshadow harp? Sorry, never heard of it.
<se_high>*: Woof woof! Grr! I'm gonna eat you!
<se_def>*: Woof woof woof!

<se_high>*: I was born and bred here in Ascantha,
and I've never set foot outside the place.
<se_high>*: If I had a bit more money, I'd like to travel the world in my very own boat! No harm in dreaming!
<se_low>*: So you came here to Ascantha in search of this Moonshadow harp, eh?
<se_low>*: I remember my parents telling me about that. They said that the then King found it on his travels and claimed it as our national treasure.

<se_low>*: It might not be true, of course.
You know how it is with these old tales.
<se_def>*: I always try to have a walk out in the sun[-]shine every day. You can't beat a bit of fresh air.
<se_def>*: Our King was so distraught when the Queen died that he shut himself away in his room for two years.

<se_def>*: But he's pulled through it all now,
and he's stronger than ever before.<page>*: That's the mark of a truly great man,
being able to recover from something like that.
<se_high>*: Aah, there's nothing like getting a bit of sunshine in your bones.

<se_high>*: People can't live without it, you know.
They start to fade away.
<se_def>*: This is Ascantha Castle. If you've come to see the King, take one of the staircases to the right or left.
<se_def>*: It's the duty of us soldiers to protect the King and all of his subjects.
<se_def>*: So we can't afford to neglect our weapons. Got to keep them up to scratch!
<se_high>*: There's usually another maid working at the castle, but she's on holiday at the moment.
<se_high>*: I just can't keep the kitchen tidy without Emma here. I'm run off my feet!
<se_def>*: The royal suite is just upstairs.
<se_def>*: This is just between you and me, but the King used to be a bit of a wet blanket in the past.
<se_def>*: But now, I'd say he's the best ruler in the world! He's like a different man.

<se_low>*: Ah, hello there! It's been a while.
You did a good thing back then for King Pavan, nay, for all of Ascantha.
<se_def>*: The King's chamber is just upstairs.
<se_def>*: Grrr... Aaoooow!
<se_high>*: Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Zzzz...
<se_low>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Zzzz...one more glass! Zzzz...
<se_high>*: Zzzz....
<se_low>*: Moonshadow harp? Hm... I've no idea!
<se_def>*: Nothing to report!
<se_def>*: Now that the King's come out of his depression, we've got a new lease of life too.
<se_def>*: It makes all the difference seeing the man we're meant to be protecting in good spirits again. Rubs off on us, you see.
<se_def>*: Moonshadow harp? Hm, if anyone knows about that, it'll be the Minister or the King himself.
<se_high>*: Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Zzzz...Emma, come back soon...zzzz...
<se_def>*: The royal suite is just upstairs.
<se_def>*: What? You want to see the King? Then you'd better come back during the daytime tomorrow.
<se_low>*: Zzzz... Zzzz...
<se_def>King Pavan: Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Huh! The villains! What sort of scoundrel would invade the royal treasure chamber!?

<se_def>King Pavan: Dear me! I'm so terribly sorry about all this.
Please just give me a little time.
<se_def>King Pavan: I'll send my very best men after those thieves, and we'll have the harp back in no time!
<se_low>*: I can't believe that such an important treasure, passed down through the generations, has been stolen! It's outrageous!

<se_def>*: First things first, we should carry out a
full investigation of the scene of the crime!
We might be able to find some kind of clue.

<se_def>*: If we don't go after the thieves soon,
we'll never catch up with them. We need to pursue them without a moment's delay!
<se_def>*: I'm not sure that there are enough of us. Maybe we should call on some volunteers from the townspeople too?
<se_def>*: This is going to be quite a blow to the King's pride, having the treasure chamber ransacked like that.<page>*: We should deal with this matter as discreetly as possible.
<se_def>*: For goodness' sake! When are we going to stop talking about it and actually go after the thieves!?
<se_def>*: If you lot are in a hurry, you should just go on ahead. We're getting nowhere here.
<se_def>*: ...You did what!? You went into the thieves' hideout and took the Moonshadow harp back from them!?
<se_def>*: Then you must tell the King! He's in conference at the moment in the royal suite.
<se_def>*: What a useless bunch the soldiers of this country are, getting <IF_SOLO>a passing traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>some passing travellers<ENDIF_SOLO> to do their dirty work for them!
<se_high>*: There's been a lot of activity at the castle lately. I wonder what's going on.
<se_high>*: Emma won't be coming back for another six weeks yet and I'm already dizzy with exhaustion. Oh, I don't know what I'm going to do!

<se_def>King Pavan: Sorry for the delay!
We're now going to summon the<endash>
<se_def>King Pavan: ...Goodness! You went after the thieves and retrieved the Moonshadow harp all by <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO>!?
<se_def>King Pavan: Why on earth did you put <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO> in such danger!? That said...

<se_def>King Pavan: I can't deny that I'm impressed! Well done!
You never cease to amaze me!
<se_def>King Pavan: I always seem to put you to so much trouble, though. It's very regrettable, very regrettable indeed.
<se_def>King Pavan: Well, I'm glad that you're all right, at any rate. And what wonderful news that the Moonshadow harp is safely back in our hands.

<se_def>King Pavan: Naturally, it now belongs to you,
just as I promised.

<se_def>King Pavan: Please, do take care on your travels.
I'll be praying that you keep safe.

<se_def>King Pavan: The Moonshadow harp is yours now,
just as I promised.
<se_def>King Pavan: And I intend to put some measures in place to ensure that this kind of thing never happens again.

<se_def>King Pavan: Now, do take care on your travels.
I'll be praying that you keep safe.
<se_low>*: Good grief! You have the Moonshadow harp!? Well, you must tell the King at once!
<se_low>*: Now we won't have to hang our heads in shame for losing one of our ancestors' greatest treasures!
<se_low>*: Thank you so much!
<se_def>*: The crooks are bound to return to the scene of the crime! We should stand guard down there!
<se_def>*: We must keep a closer eye on the treasure chamber from now on, otherwise this might happen again!

<se_def>*: We have to hurry!
We can't let those villains get away!

<se_def>*: Travellers ahead of us...!?
I knew we should've hurried!
<se_def>*: There aren't enough of us. We'd be easy marks. No point in putting ourselves in unnecessary danger.
<se_def>*: We need to build up the military so that we can be prepared for this kind of thing in the future.
<se_def>*: We have to catch the criminals before news of this gets out around town. Only a small, select team of us should go after them.
<se_def>*: Make sure nothing we've discussed leaves this room.
<se_def>*: Huh? You did the right thing going on ahead like I told you, eh?

<se_def>*: The King's too nice, you see.
So all the meetings we have here go on forever.
<se_def>*: All of my weapons are of the very finest quality! Why don't you have a look?
<se_high>*: The idea of travelling is so romantic! Must be a nice change from normal life, I should think.

<se_high>*: Business is quite tough, you know.
It's not easy to make much of a profit on things.

<se_low>*: So you've found the Moonshadow harp,
have you?
<se_low>*: Ha ha ha! You shouldn't go teasing an old woman like me, you know!
<se_low>*: That harp's a royal treasure. There's no way in the world he'd give it to any old traveller!

<se_def>*: What a lovely day it is again today!
It really sets your spirits soaring!
<se_high>*: It's the middle of the night, but the castle's still a hive of activity. It's stopping me from sleeping, actually.
<se_high>*: Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Welcome to Ascantha Castle! Our kingdom extends a warm welcome to all travellers!
<se_def>*: This is Ascantha Castle, home of His Majesty, King Pavan.

<se_def>*: Wow! You've got yourself a boat!
That's amazing.

<se_def>*: ...Hang on!
Have you just come here to boast about it?
<se_high>*: You've got your own ship?

<se_high>*: Then you must be rich!
How about a spot of shopping!?
<se_high>*: A ship, eh? I used to dream of going on a ship when I was younger.
<se_high>*: But I'm not a very good traveller. I'd get sea[-]sick just riding in a horse<->drawn cart! A ship's no place for me!

<se_high>*: This is my fort! No adults are allowed!
Go and play over there!
<se_def>*: Woof! Woof woof!

<se_high>*: What a glorious day it is again today!
Don't you think?
<se_low>*: If you drink ten buckets of well water a day, you can live to a ripe old age.
<se_low>*: Here goes... (Glug glug glug glug) ...Aaaah!
<se_def>*: ...Delightful!
<se_def>*: ...Exquisite!
<se_def>*: This town really is the best! I can't think of anywhere I'd rather be!
<se_high>*: Aren't the flowers pretty when they bloom like that? It makes my heart sing just looking at them!
<se_def>*: Please don't tell anyone about this secret room.
<se_def>*: Nothing to report!
<se_high>Emma: Hello there.
<se_high>Emma: I couldn't keep away from the castle any longer, so I decided to come back to work early.

<se_high>Emma: I always feel more relaxed when I'm working.
I'm not really one for taking holidays,
you know.
<se_high>*: Work's a million times easier now that Emma's back to help! She's a real gem, that girl.
<se_high>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...

<se_def>*: The royal suite is just upstairs.
Go on up if you're here to see the King.
<se_def>*: Ah, you're the <IF_SOLO>one<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>ones<ENDIF_SOLO> who came to the rescue when the treasure chamber was broken into! Thanks again!

<se_low>*: Ah, long time no see. ...Well, well, well.
A boat, you say! Congratulations!
<se_low>*: There are so many towns, countries and even continents out there. So much to explore!
<se_low>*: You'll have a whale of a time discovering new places and broadening your <IF_SOLO>mind<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>minds<ENDIF_SOLO>! Have a safe trip!
<se_low>*: There are lots of towns, countries and even continents out there waiting to be explored!
<se_low>*: You'll have a whale of a time discovering new places and broadening your <IF_SOLO>mind<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>minds<ENDIF_SOLO>!

<se_def>*: The King's chamber is just upstairs.
His Majesty is in the royal suite at the moment, though.
<se_def>King Pavan: Ah, it's you! How wonderful to see you looking so well! So how have things been treating you?
<se_def>King Pavan: ...Wonderful! You've managed to acquire a ship! That's excellent news!
<se_def>King Pavan: Congratulations! Hopefully now you'll be able to catch up with that villain you were pursuing! Dhoulmagus, wasn't it?

<se_def>King Pavan: I'll be praying for your success.
Have a safe journey!
<se_def>King Pavan: It's wonderful news that you managed to acquire a ship.
<se_def>King Pavan: I hope you'll catch up with that Dhoulmagus before long, as well. I'll be praying for your success.
<se_def>*: Aaaoooow!
<se_high>Emma: You can get a great view of the night sky from here.
<se_high>Emma: It's so beautiful.
<se_high>*: Zzzz... Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Zzzz...zzzz...
<se_low>*: Maybe I drank a bit too much water today. Now I have to keep going to the little girls' room!
<se_def>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Zzzz...
<se_def>*: Please don't tell anyone about this secret room.
<se_def>*: The food's been delicious ever since Emma got back! But now I've got stomach ache from eating too much!

<se_def>*: There's nothing like Emma's cooking!
She's one of a kind in the kitchen!
<se_def>*: Uuuuurh!
<se_def>*: Zzzz...nothing to...zzzz...
<se_high>*: Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: I had too long a nap this afternoon and now I can't sleep. Oh, what a bind!
<se_low>*: Uh...zzzz...
<se_def>*: His Majesty and the Minister have already retired for the night. If you wish to see them, please come back again in the morning.
<se_def>King Pavan: Zzzz...

<se_low>*: The King won't hear our prayers.
And the Goddess won't hear his.
Who should we pray to now?
<se_low>*: I just don't know any more...

<se_high>*: Good evening, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>!
Looking for something, are you?
...The Moonshadow harp?

<se_high>*: I've got a feeling I may have heard of that.
Or maybe not. Sorry, I can't quite remember.
<se_def>*: Welcome to Ascantha, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>! It's good that you've made it here safe and sound.
<se_def>*: This is Ascantha Castle, home of His Majesty, King Pavan.
<se_def>*: Red sky? ...Shh! You mustn't mention that!
<se_def>*: People say your tongue will fall out if you talk about it!
<se_high>*: The soldiers are on guard to make sure no monsters get into town.
<se_high>*: Typical! Just when we were beginning to enjoy life again, what with the end of the mourning period, we get this strange weather!<page>*: Ominous clouds are one thing, but red sky!?

<se_high>*: Hey! I hope you're going to buy something now, after taking up my time with chatter!
You are, aren't you!?

<se_high>*: Mummy says I mustn't look at the sky.
I wonder why?
<se_def>Tango: Woof woof! Aaooow!
<se_high>*: I hate this wind. It's so stiflingly warm and it smells wrong! I'm sure it's coming from that castle in the sky.
<se_def>*: ...Hm?

<se_def>*: What am I doing? Isn't it obvious?
I'm washing my eyes.
<se_def>*: I looked at the sky without thinking. Now I have to wash my eyes otherwise they'll fall out!
<se_high>*: I know what's going to happen! Just when things are looking really bad, a cool hero will come along and save the world!
<se_high>*: And THEN he'll fall in love with a cool girl like me who happens to catch his glinting eye! Oh! It'll be so COOL!
<se_def>*: Greetings, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>. Tell me, how does it look out there? How're the monsters behaving?
<se_def>*: ...Hm, I see. Then we'd better make sure we don't lower our guard.

<se_def>*: We're on guard here day and night,
at King Pavan's order.
<se_def>*: Nothing to report!
<se_low>*: I don't have that long left anyway. But the young ones have still got so much to live for.
<se_def>*: I left Maella Abbey and came here to join this church. The King and the priest are such nice people!
<se_high>*: All we can do now is pray to the Goddess.
<se_high>*: I don't see how mere humans can stand up to the fearsome monster that turned the sky red.
<se_def>*: Please don't tell anyone about this secret room.
<se_def>*: Nothing to report!
<se_def>*: You have to keep your weapons well<->maintained and ready to use at a second's notice. You never know when the monsters might attack.
<se_high>Emma: Hello there.
<se_high>Emma: We maids are rushed off our feet making nice food for the King and his men.
<se_high>Emma: We don't have time to be worried about monsters.

<se_high>*: Dear Goddess, dear departed Queen Sasha.
I beg of you both to watch over Ascantha and keep us all safe.
<se_high>*: It doesn't matter what's going on in the world. There's still cleaning to be done every day, and it needs to be done properly!

<se_high>*: A messy room makes for a messy mind,
as they say.

<se_def>*: The royal suite is just upstairs.
Go on up if you're here to see the King.
<se_low>*: Well, well. Fancy seeing you all the way out here, in Ascantha, at a time like this.
<se_low>*: We're safe from all the goings-on here, though. Castle security is water-tight! Not one monster will slip through our defences!

<se_def>*: The King's chamber is just upstairs.
His Majesty is in the royal suite at the moment, though.
<se_def>King Pavan: Ah, how good to see you! I'm so glad that you're safe!
<se_def>King Pavan: I was looking through the castle records to see if I could find anything of use to you, and I discovered this.
<se_def>King Pavan: There's an item of clothing that the queens of Ascantha wear at weddings, and it's said to contain holy powers.
<se_def>King Pavan: I don't know exactly how it's made, though. There were all sorts of things about it in the records, but, unfortunately, no exact recipe.
<se_def>King Pavan: All I could find out is that you need an angel's robe, a gold rosary and a certain dress.

<se_def>King Pavan: With those three things, you can create a holy item of clothing that will, according to the records, actually WEAKEN magical powers!<page>King Pavan: At least I think that was the gist of it...

<se_def>King Pavan: I'm afraid that's all I can do to help.
Please be careful on your journey.
<se_def>King Pavan: I'll be praying for your safety back here in Ascantha.
<se_high>Emma: Please, dear Goddess. Protect the Kingdom of Ascantha and look after my family.
<se_high>*: Mummy...why can't I...look at the sky...? Zzzz...
<se_high>*: You shouldn't be out and about at a time like this. You should be getting home.
<se_high>*: Ah-phew, ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Zzzz...my hero...zzzz...
<se_def>*: I'm writing a letter to everyone back at Maella Abbey.
<se_def>*: I want to tell them to get out of there and hurry over here to Ascantha.

<se_def>*: I'm on a break at the moment.
Ah, I'm exhausted. Huh...
<se_def>*: Every now and then, you can see that horrible castle between the clouds.
<se_def>*: I can't help but think... How am I supposed to protect Ascantha against something like that?
<se_high>*: Zzzz...
She's in a deep sleep and doesn't notice <leader> next to her.
<se_low>*: Zzzz...must improve security...zzzz.

<se_def>*: The King's chamber is just upstairs,
but he's resting now.
<se_def>*: Have I heard of a jester called Dhoulmagus?
<se_def>*: Huh! As if a jester would come to a gloomy old place like this!
<se_def>*: Look around you. Everyone here's dressed in black.
<se_def>*: If a jester had been here, he'd have stood out like a sore thumb.
